s0031: Ya Yu died, his son Gong Shu Zu Lei ascended.
s0032: Gong Shu Zu Lei died, his son Gu Gong Dan Fu ascended.
s0033: Gu Gong Dan Fu revived the work of Houji and Gong Liu, accumulated virtue and practiced righteousness, all the people of the state revered him.
s0034: The Xun Yu Rong and Di attacked him, desiring to obtain wealth and goods, he gave them to them.
s0035: Afterward they attacked again, desiring to obtain land and people.
s0036: The people were all angry and wished to fight.
s0037: Gu Gong said: 'The ruler's way is to benefit the people. Though I die, why begrudge it? I will not fight.'
s0038: He prepared to move. The people all wished to follow the ruler.
s0039: Gu Gong said: 'Those who reveal my plans will die.'
s0040: He secretly ordered his sons: 'When I leave, you must follow me quickly.'
s0041: The next day he left, and the people followed him saying: 'We will die with our ruler.'
s0042: Gu Gong feared the Rong and Di would pursue and harm the people, so he stopped and said: 'You love me, but I cannot bear to harm you.'
s0043: He separated 300 li of land to give to the Rong and Di, and moved to Qi.
s0044: Therefore, the ancient Duke abandoned the customs of the Rong and Di barbarians, and built walled cities, houses, and rooms, separating the people into distinct settlements.
s0045: He made Tai Bo and Yu Zhong cede the throne to Ji Li.
s0046: Tai Bo and Yu Zhong agreed and went to Wu and Yue, tattooed and cut their hair, and became foreigners.
s0047: The people of Wu and Yue heard of Tai Bo's virtue and all came to him.
s0048: Ji Li inherited the throne as King Wen.
s0049: King Wen was diligent in government and loved the people.
s0050: He sought out worthies and sages, and the Duke of Zhou and others came to him.
